intro: Gilliesia nahuelbutae, commonly known as the Nahuelbután grass, is a perennial grass species native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cold, arid conditions of its native habitat. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the Poaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
